title: Don‚Äôt Fly Blind! Master TBM 930 weather radar & VNAV
description:
In this 5th episode of our TBM 930 getting started series, we go inside the "high-altitude office" to explore the advanced Garmin G3000 systems that make this aircraft a world-class turboprop. If you want to fly the TBM 930 like a professional pilot, you need to understand more than just the throttle; you need to master the art of cockpit management and all-weather navigation.

What You Will Learn in this TBM 930 Tutorial: This video provides a deep dive into three critical pillars of TBM 930 flight operations:

- Garmin GWX 70 Weather Radar Mastery: We break down how to use the TBM 930 weather radar, including Tilt management, Gain calibration, and using Vertical Scan to "slice" through storms. Learn why the GWX 70 is your most vital tool when flying through IMC (Instrument Meteorological Conditions).

- Advanced IFR Navigation: ATC diversions happen fast at 330 knots. We demonstrate the "Direct-To" bezel shortcut and how to amend your flight plan mid-air without creating discontinuities in the Garmin G3000 logic.

- VNAV & Top of Descent (TOD) Logic: Setting up your descent shouldn't be guesswork. We explain how to arm VNAV, identify your TOD marker on the MFD, and ensure the TBM 930 follows a perfect 3-degree vertical path to your destination.

- The TBM 930 vs. Chuck Yeager: We also dive into the fascinating history of this aircraft, specifically how the TBM 930 broke a long-standing New York to Paris speed record previously held by the legendary Chuck Yeager in a Piper Cheyenne.

Why the TBM 930? Whether you are a Microsoft Flight Simulator (MSFS) enthusiast or a student of real-world aviation, the TBM 930 represents the pinnacle of single-engine performance. By the end of this TBM 930 tutorial series, you will move from being a passenger to a true flight manager.
